intro: Willughbeia lunduensis, commonly known as the Lundu sand forest tree, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments and plays a vital role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Its seeds are dispersed by animals, contributing to the regeneration of forest ecosystems.
